<figure class="tmblr-full" data-orig-height="92" data-orig-width="480"></figure><figure data-url="https%3A%2F%2Fwww.youtube.com%2Fwatch%3Fv%3DvI3bvYF45oc" data-orig-height="304" data-orig-width="540" data-provider="youtube" class="tmblr-embed tmblr-full"><iframe id="youtube_iframe" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/vI3bvYF45oc?feature=oembed&enablejsapi=1&origin=https://safe.txmblr.com&wmode=opaque" allowfullscreen="" frameborder="0" height="304" width="540"></iframe></figure>Hazard-ish shared with us the first part of a little series in which he constructs an SSTO refueling station on Minmus - built using only SSTOs of course!

Edited August 29, 2015 by Vanamonde

Woohooo! It's official!

Yeah to everyone that has no idea what Single Stage To Orbit means.

Clap hands - I part company.
Wow, I can't even build an SSTO, let alone fly it to Minmus and back!

Haha, wow! I was certain Scott Manley was going to get this week's feature due to him starting a new KSP series

This really means a lot

I can't even imagine how you did this. My ships can't do that. Looks like no KER or MechJeb either!?

I see you were probably using Infernal Robotics. What were you using for engines? That also looked like it was made of a gazillion parts too! Performance must have suuuuuccccckked.

My best SSTOs are small, and usually using mods (currently rocking the SCRAMjet mod.)

I can't even imagine how you did this. My ships can't do that. Looks like no KER or MechJeb either!?

I see you were probably using Infernal Robotics. What were you using for engines?

Nope, as the title said, there are no mods here (other than visual ones)! The hinge was created using the 'structural pylon', a part with a very flexible joint connection - all I had to do was create the tail as a self-assembly, attach it to the structural pylon and lock in it place with some docking ports.

I used nuclear engines since no other engine could provide enough delta-v and, although they are inside an engine cluster, the way I arranged the RAPIERs meant I could place the nuclear engines there without part clipper.

Hope that helps

Wow, I can't even build an SSTO, let alone fly it to Minmus and back!

Mk1 command pod with small docking port on top. 2 x FL-T800 fuel tanks, T-45 engine.

SSTO.

Refuel in orbit.

Go to Minmus and back.

The hinge was created using the 'structural pylon', a part with a very flexible joint connection - all I had to do was create the tail as a self-assembly, attach it to the structural pylon and lock in it place with some docking ports.

..

Hope that helps

...? Can you make a video gif or series of pix of that? A how-to guide!?
I'm not impressed,,, I'm flabbergasted! A must see for every KSP player. And I second capran, give us something to chew on.

Haha, wow! I was certain Scott Manley was going to get this week's feature due to him starting a new KSP series

This really means a lot

Wow......just wow

First of all:

Beautifully enigneered parts you have there. Love it.

How did you get this perfect Minmus encounter?

I burn tonns of d/v to wiggle my way to Minmus every time I have to bring something up there.

My maneuver node never hits it in one go. And you simply eyeballed the correct inclination and timing, or what? oO
